verses.verse: Moreover the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came unto me, saying<WH559>,

Also, thou son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> unto the land<WH127> of Israel<WH3478>; An end<WH7093>, the end<WH7093> is come<WH935> upon the four<WH702> corners<WH3671> of the land<WH776>.

Now is the end<WH7093> come upon thee, and I will send<WH7971> mine anger<WH639> upon thee, and will judge<WH8199> thee according to thy ways<WH1870>, and will recompense<WH5414> upon thee all thine abominations<WH8441>. recompense: Heb. give

And mine eye<WH5869> shall not spare<WH2347> thee, neither will I have pity<WH2550>: but I will recompense<WH5414> thy ways<WH1870> upon thee, and thine abominations<WH8441> shall be in the midst<WH8432> of thee: and ye shall know<WH3045> that I am the LORD<WH3068>.
Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; An evil<WH7451>, an only<WH259> evil<WH7451>, behold, is come<WH935>.
An end<WH7093> is come<WH935>, the end<WH7093> is come<WH935>: it watcheth<WH6974> for thee; behold, it is come<WH935>. watcheth for: Heb. awaketh against

The morning<WH6843> is come<WH935> unto thee, O thou that dwellest<WH3427> in the land<WH776>: the time<WH6256> is come<WH935> <WH935>, the day<WH3117> of trouble<WH4103> is near<WH7138>, and not the sounding again<WH1906> of the mountains<WH2022>. sounding: or, echo

Now will I shortly<WH7138> pour out<WH8210> my fury<WH2534> upon thee, and accomplish<WH3615> mine anger<WH639> upon thee: and I will judge<WH8199> thee according to thy ways<WH1870>, and will recompense<WH5414> thee for all thine abominations<WH8441>.

And mine eye<WH5869> shall not spare<WH2347>, neither will I have pity<WH2550>: I will recompense<WH5414> thee according to thy ways<WH1870> and thine abominations<WH8441> that are in the midst<WH8432> of thee; and ye shall know<WH3045> that I am the LORD<WH3068> that smiteth<WH5221>. thee according: Heb. upon thee, etc
Behold the day<WH3117>, behold, it is come<WH935>: the morning<WH6843> is gone forth<WH3318>; the rod<WH4294> hath blossomed<WH6692>, pride<WH2087> hath budded<WH6524>.

Violence<WH2555> is risen up<WH6965> into a rod<WH4294> of wickedness<WH7562>: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude<WH1995>, nor of any<WH1991> of theirs: neither shall there be wailing<WH5089> for them. theirs: or, their tumultuous persons: Heb. tumult

The time<WH6256> is come<WH935>, the day<WH3117> draweth near<WH5060>: let not the buyer<WH7069> rejoice<WH8055>, nor the seller<WH4376> mourn<WH56>: for wrath<WH2740> is upon all the multitude<WH1995> thereof.

For the seller<WH4376> shall not return<WH7725> to that which is sold<WH4465>, although they were yet alive<WH2416>: for the vision<WH2377> is touching the whole multitude<WH1995> thereof, which shall not return<WH7725>; neither shall any<WH376> strengthen<WH2388> himself in the iniquity<WH5771> of his life<WH2416>. although they: Heb. though their life were yet among the living in the: or, whose life is in his iniquity the iniquity: Heb. his iniquity
They have blown<WH8628> the trumpet<WH8619>, even to make all ready<WH3559>; but none goeth<WH1980> to the battle<WH4421>: for my wrath<WH2740> is upon all the multitude<WH1995> thereof.

The sword<WH2719> is without<WH2351>, and the pestilence<WH1698> and the famine<WH7458> within<WH1004>: he that is in the field<WH7704> shall die<WH4191> with the sword<WH2719>; and he that is in the city<WH5892>, famine<WH7458> and pestilence<WH1698> shall devour<WH398> him.

But they that escape<WH6403> of them shall escape<WH6412>, and shall be on the mountains<WH2022> like doves<WH3123> of the valleys<WH1516>, all of them mourning<WH1993>, every one<WH376> for his iniquity<WH5771>.
All hands<WH3027> shall be feeble<WH7503>, and all knees<WH1290> shall be weak<WH3212> as water<WH4325>. be weak: Heb. go into water

They shall also gird<WH2296> themselves with sackcloth<WH8242>, and horror<WH6427> shall cover<WH3680> them; and shame<WH955> shall be upon all faces<WH6440>, and baldness<WH7144> upon all their heads<WH7218>.

They shall cast<WH7993> their silver<WH3701> in the streets<WH2351>, and their gold<WH2091> shall be removed<WH5079>: their silver<WH3701> and their gold<WH2091> shall not be able<WH3201> to deliver<WH5337> them in the day<WH3117> of the wrath<WH5678> of the LORD<WH3068>: they shall not satisfy<WH7646> their souls<WH5315>, neither fill<WH4390> their bowels<WH4578>: because it is the stumblingblock<WH4383> of their iniquity<WH5771>. removed: Heb. for a separation, or, uncleanness it is: or, their iniquity is their stumblingblock

As for the beauty<WH6643> of his ornament<WH5716>, he set<WH7760> it in majesty<WH1347>: but they made<WH6213> the images<WH6754> of their abominations<WH8441> and of their detestable things<WH8251> therein: therefore have I set<WH5414> it far<WH5079> from them. set it far: or, made it unto them an unclean thing
And I will give<WH5414> it into the hands<WH3027> of the strangers<WH2114> for a prey<WH957>, and to the wicked<WH7563> of the earth<WH776> for a spoil<WH7998>; and they shall pollute<WH2490> it.

My face<WH6440> will I turn<WH5437> also from them, and they shall pollute<WH2490> my secret<WH6845> place: for the robbers<WH6530> shall enter<WH935> into it, and defile<WH2490> it. robbers: or, burglers
Make<WH6213> a chain<WH7569>: for the land<WH776> is full<WH4390> of bloody<WH1818> crimes<WH4941>, and the city<WH5892> is full<WH4390> of violence<WH2555>.

Wherefore I will bring<WH935> the worst<WH7451> of the heathen<WH1471>, and they shall possess<WH3423> their houses<WH1004>: I will also make the pomp<WH1347> of the strong<WH5794> to cease<WH7673>; and their holy places<WH6942> shall be defiled<WH2490> <WH5157>. their holy: or, they shall inherit their holy places
Destruction<WH7089> cometh<WH935>; and they shall seek<WH1245> peace<WH7965>, and there shall be none. Destruction: Heb. Cutting off

Mischief<WH1943> shall come<WH935> upon mischief<WH1943>, and rumour<WH8052> shall be upon rumour<WH8052>; then shall they seek<WH1245> a vision<WH2377> of the prophet<WH5030>; but the law<WH8451> shall perish<WH6> from the priest<WH3548>, and counsel<WH6098> from the ancients<WH2205>.

The king<WH4428> shall mourn<WH56>, and the prince<WH5387> shall be clothed<WH3847> with desolation<WH8077>, and the hands<WH3027> of the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> shall be troubled<WH926>: I will do<WH6213> unto them after their way<WH1870>, and according to their deserts<WH4941> will I judge<WH8199> them; and they shall know<WH3045> that I am the LORD<WH3068>. according: Heb. with their judgments
